Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the previous level of danger in El Paso, stating that it was one of the most dangerous cities in the US.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that El Paso was never one of the most dangerous cities in the US, as stated by the mayor.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific data or evidence to support the assertion that El Paso was one of the most dangerous cities before the border fence was built.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the border fence was the sole deterrent for crime reduction in El Paso, which is a problematic assumption as other factors may have contributed to the decrease in crime.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the decrease in crime in El Paso, such as nationwide trends in crime reduction.
